info.name: Qiy Node
info.description:
This document describes the Qiy Node API:
a [Qiy Node](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#43-qiy-node) is a [Node](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap10.html#_Toc489946084) that hosts  a single [Technology Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap10.html#_Toc489946097) which enables a single [Individual](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#41-qiy-users) to orchestrate his services as follows:
1. The Individual chooses and launches an [End User App](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#7428b29e-a414-493a-82e2-b39dabd2d5dc).
2. The [Individual connects with a Service Provider](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#6488c78c-9460-4dd1-bb8f-9285d5943167) using a [Connect Token of a Service Provider]().
3. The [Service Provider requests for a feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#fcea7385-8304-47b4-96ac-0854e8a46da6).
4. The [Individual receives the request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#b81e75d9-cc97-4be1-ac17-976737e516de) and assigns the feed to one of the Service Providers in his [Service Portfolio](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/Definitions.md#service-portfolio).
5. The [Service Provider accesses the feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#abf8f21c-0f31-4086-ad5e-49d2ec468f43) whenever the service is required.

item.name: End User App
Setup
item.description:
An End User App can only access the Qiy Trust Network under the following preconditions:
1. The End User App uses a valid [Access Provider Token](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#962509fc-cd2a-463d-85e4-f1772c54ff2c).
2. The [End User App correctly authenticates Qiy Node requests](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#962509fc-cd2a-463d-85e4-f1772c54ff2c).
3. The End User App must allow End Users to use a [new Qiy Node](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#de1a3109-4fca-43f8-ab01-11436d62d097) or reuse an existing one.

item.name: Orchestration

exec: // Extract the orchestrationRequestUrl from the 'extraData'-member of the 'USER_ACION_MESSAGE'-event.

request.description: A Qiy Node Client can use this call to get the details of a received message that requires user interaction using a userActionMessageUrl extracted from a [User Action Message Event](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#746ea152-a210-4ab2-9a2f-8a497ed78799).

item.description:
An [End User App](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#7428b29e-a414-493a-82e2-b39dabd2d5dc) can process Orchestration Requests (aka [Feed Requests](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#1a616f10-1bb8-4646-8b3e-357946599321)) as follows:
1. [Start listening to events](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#7830f7e9-d182-4b51-a2e6-058cdfead040).
2. Wait for a [User Action Message Event](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#746ea152-a210-4ab2-9a2f-8a497ed78799).
3. Extract the userActionMessageUrl from the 'extraData'-field of the event.
4. [Fetch the message using the messageUrl](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#30a0373f-2ca0-41d6-b712-ba7bc0573dbb) and extract the feed request containing the possible service providers and related actionUrls.
5. Present the request to the End User and capture the result, e.g. the selected Service Providers .
6. If and when applicable, [assign the feed to the selected service provider](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#c908455a-867e-4ca3-b8aa-5a293652f840) using the related actionUrl.

item.name: Connect with a Service Provider
item.description:
This section describes how an [End User App that has access the Qiy Node of an End User](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#265b0209-d297-429d-a891-f1eba6cf2083) can establish a connection with a Service Provider using a Connect Token of this Service Provider.
This goes as follows:
1. The [End User App starts listening to events](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#a0dfd715-bcb9-4bfd-9a94-c5e97edaeb1f).
2. The End User App sends a [Connection Create Request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#01a84413-0b4c-47da-948a-824082408b40) using the Connect Token.

An [End User App](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#5-the-application-layer) is a [Qiy Node Client](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#821514ce-5005-4408-be95-a400b6b4181c) which enables an [Individual](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#41-qiy-users) to [process orchestration requests](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#b81e75d9-cc97-4be1-ac17-976737e516de).

item.name: Service Provider
General
Setup
Connect Request Endpoint
item.description: A Connect Request Endpoint can be used to process connect requests.

item.name: Feed Assigment Endpoint
item.description: An Feed Assignment Endpoint is a [Technology Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap10.html#_Toc489946097) which can be used by a Service Provider to receive [Feed Assignment Requests](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#c908455a-867e-4ca3-b8aa-5a293652f840) for his services.

item.name: Service Catalogue

exec: // Use '//Dynamic Endpoint Addresses/GET Api' to get the serviceCatalogueEndpointUrl

query.description: If False or None, only external services will be gotten.

request.description:
A Service Provider can use Set Service Catalogue to:
1. Update his Service Catalogue
2. Define the [Orchestration Request Forward Endpoint]

item.description:
A [Service Provider](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e351a4a2-a31a-4b35-af56-8b3d592d1dd4) publishes the (data) services it provides via Qiy in his Service Catalogue, which consists of an array of urls for service descriptions with a description of the associated [Feed Assignment Endpoints](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e1b569b8-287d-41dc-ad3d-cd576ac1af67).

The main part of the Service Description consists of a list of urls for the description of the operations of the service, except for data services: these always consist of one operation (namely: 'provide data of a certain data category') the operation description url of which is the same as the service description url.

Before a Service Provider can provide services via Qiy he has to make the following preparations:
1. Describe the services make these descriptions publicly available.
2. Setup [Feed Assignment Endpoints](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e1b569b8-287d-41dc-ad3d-cd576ac1af67) for his services.
2. Setup a [Connect Request Endpoint](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e8aa13ba-4301-47c9-81a2-522dc52e296c) for easily processing connect requests.
3. Prepare the Computer systems to correctly produce [authenticated requests](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#962509fc-cd2a-463d-85e4-f1772c54ff2c).
1. Register with an [Access Provider] to whitelist the endpoints and receive a [Qiy Node Credential], a [Access Provider Token].
2. Configure the computer system for the Qiy Node.
3. [Publish the Service Catalogue with Qiy](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#a8223ff0-e5d6-4dbd-8c3b-3625b6e460a0).

The topics in this section apply to all types of Service Providers:
1. [Setup](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#0225107f-58a0-4ff9-b82c-45240e549541)
2. [Connect with an Individual](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#49992baf-fc29-4d81-8ffa-12da0c8493d7)

item.name: Feeds
item.description:
A Relying Party can access a Services that is orchestrated by an Individual as follows:
0. [Start listening to Events](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#7830f7e9-d182-4b51-a2e6-058cdfead040).
1. [Request for feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#fcea7385-8304-47b4-96ac-0854e8a46da6).
2. Wait for a [Data Reference Received Event-v2](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#6a83bdd6-5a06-4022-8864-db5e1f75d01d).
3. Extract the feed id from the event.
4. Use the feed id to [access the feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#abf8f21c-0f31-4086-ad5e-49d2ec468f43).

A [Service Provider](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#42-service-provider) is a [Qiy User](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/High-Level%20Architectural%20Overview.md#41-qiy-users) that provides [Services](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#a8223ff0-e5d6-4dbd-8c3b-3625b6e460a0) via the Qiy Trust Network.
A Service Provider can be a Relying Party or a Data Provider:
1. A [Data Provider](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#d0c5c5f9-2e94-4b0c-9933-0186d39560be) is a Service Provider that provides data services.
2. A [Relying Party](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#bf6403a7-89b2-4028-95c3-b39d5d444bf3) is a Service Provider that provides Services that depends on other services.

item.name: Qiy Node Client
Authentication
item.description:
In order to be able to access a Qiy Node, a Qiy Node Client MUST have:
1. A Qiy Node Credential consisting of a Qiy Node Id, a primary key and a Transport Password.
2. A valid Access Provider Token.

## Access Provider Token
All requests to a Qiy Node MUST be authenticated with a valid Access Provider Token.

## Authorization Header Parameter
All requests but the [Qiy Node Create Request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#de1a3109-4fca-43f8-ab01-11436d62d097) and the [Api Request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#22714043-ebc0-4a1d-87eb-2d469c8d3b82) MUST be authenticated with a correct Authorization header, for details see [chapter 4 Authentication](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#4-authentication) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).
See [GET Api](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#22714043-ebc0-4a1d-87eb-2d469c8d3b82) for an example of an authenticated request.

## Password Header Parameter
Request that require the use of the Transport Layer MUST be authenticated with a valid Transport Passowrd in the 'password' header parameter of the request.
See also [the Qiy Node requests that have been labeled as 'Transport Requests'](https://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node-api.html#TransportRequests) in the [Digit Me Qiy Node API in Open API format](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node-api.json).

item.name: Connect Tokens
item.description:
A Connect Token is a [token](https://github.com/qiyfoundation/Qiy-Scheme/blob/topic/qiy-node-interface/Definitions.md#token) which enables Individuals to establish an initially anonymous [connection](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#96dd4e14-3580-4230-b859-a117000906f5) with another Qiy User.
A Connect Token can be created and used both online and offline:

1. When online, Connect Tokens can be created using a [Connect Token Create Request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#b8ad134d-b693-48d7-bdac-5a9a63be319f).
2. When offline, a [Connect Token can be created locally](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#fbc534ce-9453-4344-ad66-a5ba3a547b41) and registered later using a [Connect Token Register Request](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#9251bd1f-c8d9-49e1-91fb-a9a567a68aef) when online again.

item.name: Connect Token Create Endpoint
item.description: The Connect Token Create Endpoint ({{ctCreateEndpointUrl}}) can be used to work with [Connect Tokens](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e2324a33-022e-4b02-bde0-c438d12b2683).

item.name: Connections Endpoint
item.description: The Connections Endpoint can be used to work with [Connections](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#96dd4e14-3580-4230-b859-a117000906f5).

item.name: Events Endpoint
item.description: The Events endpoint can be used to receive [Events](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#a0dfd715-bcb9-4bfd-9a94-c5e97edaeb1f).

item.name: References Endpoint
item.description: The References Endpoint can be used to work with [Feeds](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#1a616f10-1bb8-4646-8b3e-357946599321).

item.name: Reference Endpoint
item.description: The Reference Endpoint can be used to work with a single [Feed](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#1a616f10-1bb8-4646-8b3e-357946599321).

item.name: Create Endpoint
item.description: The Create Endpoint can be used to create a Qiy Node, or rather: request the creation of one with an Access Provider.

item.name: Delete Endpoint
item.description: The Delete Endpoint can be used to delete a Qiy Node, or rather: request the deletion of one with an Access Provider.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.value: Cache-Control, Pragma, Origin, Authorization, Content-Type, X-Requested-With, Set-Cookie, Cookie, Accept, password
header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

item.name: Events
Persistent Id Event
item.description: The Persistent Id Event is an Event that is fired when a [Service Provider connects with an Individual](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#49992baf-fc29-4d81-8ffa-12da0c8493d7).

item.name: User Action Message Event
item.description: The User Action Message Event is fired by a Qiy Node when it receives a [message]() that requires interaction with the End User.

item.name: Data Reference Received Event-v2
item.description: The Data Reference Received Event-v2 can be used by a Service Provider to obtain a feed from an Individual.

exec: // Use '//Dynamic Endpoint Addresses/Get Api' to the eventsEndpointUrl.

item.description: A Qiy Node can send Server-Sent Events to communicate with a Qiy Node Client.

item.name: Lifecycle

request.description: See also [section 3.1 Create Qiy Node](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#31-create-qiy-node) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

The Delete Qiy Node request can be used to delete a Qiy Node, or rather: request the deletion of one with an Access Provider.

See also [Section 3.2 Delete Qiy Node](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#32-delete-qiy-node) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.description: See also  [chapter 3 Lifecycle](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#3-lifecycle) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.name: Messages
item.description:
A Qiy Node Client can exchange Messages with other clients that it has a [connection](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#96dd4e14-3580-4230-b859-a117000906f5) with.
For more information, please refer to [chapter 7. Messaging](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#7-messaging) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.name: Servers
item.description:
Digital Me provides the Qiy Node service on different servers.
For details, please refer to [section 2.3 QS User Node Servers](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#23-qs-user-node-servers) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.name: Service Desk
item.description: For contact details of the Digital Me Service Desk, please refer to [section 2.1 Service Desk](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#21-service-desk) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

item.name: Versions
item.description: For more information on versions, please refer to [section 2.4 Versions](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#24-versions) of the [Digital Me Qiy Node specification](https://github.com/digital-me/qiy-node/blob/topic/data-reuse/qs-user-node.md#1-introduction).

A Qiy Node Client is any [Application Service](http://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap09.html#_Toc489946075) that accesses a Qiy Node.
This section addresses topics that are relevant for developers of both [End User Apps](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#7428b29e-a414-493a-82e2-b39dabd2d5dc) and computer systems of [Service Providers](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e351a4a2-a31a-4b35-af56-8b3d592d1dd4):
1. [Authentication](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#962509fc-cd2a-463d-85e4-f1772c54ff2c)
1. [Connect Tokens](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#e2324a33-022e-4b02-bde0-c438d12b2683)
1. [Connections](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#96dd4e14-3580-4230-b859-a117000906f5)
1. [Dynamic Endpoint Addresses](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#6fb4e75c-8dc0-4d4b-a12c-544c1a2366ce)
1. [Events](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#a0dfd715-bcb9-4bfd-9a94-c5e97edaeb1f)
2. [Lifecycle](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#53ee086e-0d81-4f0c-9b51-3f5d4f4f039c)
2. [Messages](https://qiy.api.digital-me.nl/#9a94a941-4582-4a71-af3d-88fe46e0af76)
